item.title: Dissertation
item.description: © 2025, Chuyu Tian The aim of my dissertation is to investigate the justificatory status of rules in Aristotle’s ethics. How does Aristotle’s ethics differ from a rule-based one? In my dissertation, I clarify the meta-ethical status of ethical judgments and investigate the foundation of Aristotle’s ethics. In the first two chapters, I argue for a person-centric account of Aristotle’s ethics. The virtuous person is not only an exemplar with unique epistemic access to ethically salient particulars, but a measure of what is good to human beings: the virtuous person, qua in a well-ordered, harmonious state, defines what is good for a human being.
